title: Representations - Connect f-f prime-f double prime

content.question: The function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is differentiable and decreasing on the interval <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to x is less than or equal to 6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has exactly two points of inflection on this interval. Which of the following could be the graph of <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, the derivative of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 1 is indicated on the x axis. The curve begins on the y axis, below the origin. It moves downward and to the right at first, and begins to level off as it approaches a point below the x axis, where x equals 3. At this point, it continues almost horizontally until it reaches a point where x equals approximately 4.5. Then, the curve moves gradually downward and to the right until it ends below the x axis.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 1 is indicated on the x axis. The curve begins on the y axis, below the origin. It moves upward and to the right at first, and reaches a local maximum at a point below the x axis, where x is approximately equal to 0.8. At this point, it moves downward and to the right, and reaches a local minimum at a point far below the x axis, where x is approximately equal to 3.6. It then moves upward and to the right, crossing the x axis at approximately 5.4, and ends far above the x axis.

The figure presents the graph of two curves in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 1 is indicated on the x axis. The first curve begins on the y axis, below the origin. It moves downward and to the right and ends far below the x axis, where x equals 2. The second curve is a parabola that begins where the first curve ends. It moves upward and to the right until it reaches a maximum on the x axis at 4. It then moves downward and to the right until it ends at a point far below the x axis, where x equals 6.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 1 is indicated on the x axis. The curve begins on the y axis, below the origin. It moves downward and to the right at first, and reaches a local minimum at a point below the x axis, where x is approximately equal to 0.8. At this point, it moves upward and to the right, and reaches a local maximum at a point just below the x axis, where x is approximately equal to 3. It then moves downward and to the right, and reaches a local minimum far below the x axis, where x is approximately equal to 5.4 It then moves upward and ends below the x axis.

content.answer: The figure presents the graph of two curves in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 1 is indicated on the x axis. The first curve begins on the y axis, below the origin. It moves downward and to the right and ends far below the x axis, where x equals 2. The second curve is a parabola that begins where the first curve ends. It moves upward and to the right until it reaches a maximum on the x axis at 4. It then moves downward and to the right until it ends at a point far below the x axis, where x equals 6.

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
